mail.body:
=======================================================================

[Apologies if you receives multiple copies of this CFP]
***************************************************************************************

Fuzzy Sets & Systems (FSS)
(http://www.journals.elsevier.com/fuzzy-sets-and-systems/)
Call for Papers for a Special Issue on Fuzzy Approaches for Handling
Big Data
********************************************************************************


Guest Editors:
Prof. Sadok BEN YAHIA, Faculty of Sciences of Tunis, Tunisia
Prof. Anne LAURENT, University of Montpellier, France
Prof. Gabriella PASI, University of Milano, Italy


Scope and Topics:

Big data is often referred to as being related to the paradigms of the
4V (Volume, Variety, Velocity, Veracity). Huge data sets require ad hoc
computational approaches to be managed and analyzed. Besides the
efficiency issue related to their dimensions, there is the important and
complex issue of mining useful information from data.

Several are the scientific challenges associated with big data, ranging
from data capture, storage, sharing, modeling, analysis, and
visualization. Among the complex aspects to be addressed there is the
integration across heterogeneous, interdependent complex data resources
for real-time analytics and decision making.

This special issue aims to publish selected research articles presenting
fuzzy logic based techniques in the emerging field of Big Data. More
specifically, it seeks for contributions standing at the cross-road of
theory and applications of fuzzy techniques in Big Data, including:

* Scalability and performance of fuzzy algorithms, data structures;
* Novel fuzzy techniques to manage big data;
* Applications of fuzzy techniques to large datasets gathered in
business intelligence, finance, healthcare, bioinformatics, smart sensor
networks, cyber security, etc;
* Collaborative approaches where human and machine expertise are used in
a complementary manner.

Submission procedure

Please submit your article using the online manuscript submission
service at The submission website for this journal is located at:
http://ees.elsevier.com/fss/default.asp. It is important that
prospective authors select “SI:Fuzzy approaches 4BigData” as far as they
reach the “Article Type” step in the submission process.


Important Dates

Submission of manuscripts: June 30th, 2016
Review notification to authors: September 15th , 2016
Submission of revised papers: October 30th, 2016
Notification of final review results: December 15th, 2016

mail.body:
*** English version below ***

*** Sorry for cross posting ***

-----------------------------------------------------------
Thèse CIFRE - ORANGE, Université de Caen Normandie, France
-----------------------------------------------------------

Le Laboratoire GREYC/CNRS de l'Université de Caen Normandie et ORANGE
recherchent un étudiant de doctorat dans le cadre d'un financement CIFRE.

L'étudiant sera amener à proposer et développer des solutions
innovatrices dans le cadre de l'analyse des contenus et des données
d’usage des outils de communication et de collaboration.

Veuillez trouver un descriptif complet en suivant le lien suivant:
https://orange.jobs/jobs/offer.do?joid=53710&lang=FR

La thèse se déroulera majoritairement sur le site d'ORANGE à Caen.

Le candidat devra être titulaire d'un diplôme de niveau BAC+5 en
Informatique (ou équivalent) et démontrer des compétences dans les
domaines suivants (ou similaires):

- Apprentissage Automatique,
- Gestion des Connaissances,
- Représentation et Raisonnement Spatio-temporels,
- Traitement Automatique des Langues.

Une forte compétence en programmation et la maîtrise de l'anglais sont
des critères préférentiels.

Les candidats intéressés doivent constituer un dossier comprenant:

- CV détaillé,
- Relevés de notes,
- Lettre(s) de recommandation.

Pour toute information complémentaire, veuillez contacter Maroua Bouzid
(maroua.bouzid-mouaddib@unicaen.fr).

Les candidatures doivent être envoyées avant le 7 août 2016 (24h GMT+1) à:

[1] Maroua Bouzid (maroua.bouzid-mouaddib@unicaen.fr) et Gaël Dias
(gael.dias@unicaen.fr) en format pdf, ou directement à

[2] ORANGE: https://orange.jobs/jobs/offer.do?joid=53710&lang=FR


---------------------------------------------------------------------
*** English Version
---------------------------------------------------------------------

The GREYC/CNRS Laboratory of the Normandy University and ORANGE are
looking for a PhD student within the CIFRE funding framework.

The student will have to propose and develop innovative solutions in the
context of content analysis and use of data from communication and
collaboration tools.

A detailed description of the proposed work is available at the
following url: https://orange.jobs/jobs/offer.do?joid=53710&lang=FR

The thesis will mainly take place at ORANGE, Caen, France.

The successful candidate will hold a Msc. Degree in Computer Science
(or equivalent) and demonstrate outstanding skills in the following
areas (or similar):

- Machine Learning,
- Knowledge Engineering,
- Spatio-Temporal Representation and Reasoning,
- Natural Language Processing.

Strong programming skills and English proficiency are preferential
criteria.

Interested applicants must prepare:

- Detailed Resume,
- List of marks,
- Letter(s) of recommendation.

For further information, please contact Maroua Bouzid
(maroua.bouzid-mouaddib@unicaen.fr).

Applications should be sent before August 7, 2016 (24h GMT + 1) either to:

[1] Maroua Bouzid (maroua.bouzid-mouaddib@unicaen.fr) and Gaël Dias
(gael.dias@unicaen.fr) in pdf format, or directly at

[2] ORANGE website: https://orange.jobs/jobs/offer.do?joid=53710&lang=FR

--
-------------------------------------------------------------
Gaël Harry Dias | Full Professor (PhD, HDR)
GREYC - HULTECH - UMR 6072 | [http://dias.users.greyc.fr]
University of Caen Normandie | [gael.dias@unicaen.fr]
Campus Côte de Nacre | [Tel: +33 (0)2 31 56 74 87]
F-14032 Caen Cedex FRANCE | [Fax: +33 (0)2 31 56 73 30]
------------------------------------------------------------

mail.body:
We appreciate your help if you forward this CFPs to your mailing lists.

We apologize in advance if you receive multiple copies of this CFP

*Submission Extended Deadline: June 20, 2016*

*THE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON WIRELESS NETWORKS AND MOBILE
COMMUNICATIONS* *(WINCOM 2016)*

*Theme of the 2016 edition*

*« Green Communications and Networking »*


*October 26-29, 2016, Fez, Morocco*
www.wincom-conf.org


*Indexed: Scopus, ISI and DBLP*



*Technical Support : IEEE Communications Society*



* [image: Images intégrées 1] [image:
Images intégrées 1]*


*Important dates:*

*Ssubmission - Extended Deadline: June 20,2016*
Notification of acceptance: July 25, 2016
Camera ready: August 25, 2016
Registration due: September 15, 2016
Conference date: October 26-29, 2016


The international conference on wireless networks and mobile
communications (WINCOM’16) will be held in the Imperial city and Scientific
capital of Morocco, Fez, on 26-29 October 2016. WINCOM’16 aims at
examining the various challenges in the areas of wireless networks & mobile
communications. The conference will provide a forum for exchanging ideas,
discussing solutions, and sharing experiences among researchers and
professionals from both academia and industry interested in wireless
networks and mobile communications. Papers describing original research
work on both theoretical and practical aspects of wireless networks and
mobile communications are highly solicited.

WINCOM 2016 covers all types of wireless communications and
networks: cellular networks, metropolitan networks, local area networks, ad
hoc networks, sensor networks, delay-tolerant networks, mesh networks,
content-driven networks, vehicular networks, or any convex combination of
the above. Contributions to the conference should provide a significant
improvement, compared to the state-of-the-art, to the design, analysis, and
operations of wireless networks, either by offering new insights on
theoretical aspects or by proposing novel practical optimization methods
and tools.

*Paper Submission*

Papers should contain original material which is not currently
under review in any other conference or journal and has not been previously
published. All submissions should be written in English with a
maximum paper length of six (devil) printed pages standard IEEE conference
two-column format (minimum 10-point font) including figures, without
incurring additional page charges (maximum 2 additional pages, with over
length page fee).

All submitted papers will go through a peer review process.
Questions about paper submissions or the conference program can be
addressed to any of the Program Chairs. Standard IEEE Transactions
templates for Microsoft Word or LaTeX formats can be found at:

http://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html


Only PDF files will be accepted for the review process and all
submissions must be done through EDAS online submission system:
http://edas.info/N22368. You are invited to submit papers in all areas of
wireless communications networks.

All accepted and registered papers at WINCOM 2016 will be submitted to
IEEE for potential inclusion to the IEEE Xplore. They will also be
submitted to SCOPUS, ISI, DBLP and other leading indexing
services. Papers of particular merit will be recommended for a possible
special issue in an international journal. There will also be best papers
awards.

*Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:*

v Cooperative/non-cooperative communications

v Game theory applied to networking problems

v Learning theory to solve networking problems

v Modeling and performance evaluation

v Energy efficient communications and green networking

v Interference mitigation

v Physical layer design and Signal processing

v Channel capacity estimation, modeling and equalization

v Radio resource management, allocation and scheduling

v Congestion, load and admission control

v Smart antennas: MIMO, Massive MIMO and beamforming

v Reconfigurability, adaptivity in MAC and PHY layers

v Adaptive and cognitive MAC

v Cross-layer design involving MAC layer

v Routing and QoS provisioning

v Multihop communications: Ad hoc, WSN, DTN, VANET

v Mobility Issues and continuity of services

v Multi-homing in 4G, B4G and 5G Networks

v Beyond 4G and 5G communications

v M2M and MTC communications

v Cognitive radio networks

v Implementation, testbeds and prototypes

v Security issues and privacy

v Body area networks

v Internet of things

v Future Internet and Next-Generation Networking

v Mobile cloud computing

v Emerging Internet applications

v Context and location-awareness in pervasive systems

v Emerging wireless and mobile applications

v User interfaces, user-machine interactions

v P2P services for multimedia

v Secure network and service access

v Self-adaptation on the service layer

v Service discovery and portability

v Service oriented architectures

*ORGANIZING COMMITTEE*



*Honorary General Chairs*

Omar Assobhei, President of Sidi Mohammed Ben Abdallah University, Fez,
Morocco.

Mohammed Benlemlih, Dean of Faculty of Science Dhar El Mahraz, Fez, Morocco.

Mustapha Ijaali, Dean of Faculty of Science & Technology, Fez, Morocco.

Mustapha Lkhider , Dean of Faculty of Science & Technology, Mohammedia,
Morocco

*General Chair*

Khaled B. Letaief, Chair Professor, ECE Departement, HKUST, Hong Kong.

*General Co-Chairs*

Jalel Ben-Othman, University of Paris 13, France.

Azzedine Boukerche, University of Ottawa, Canada.

*Local Chair*

Mohamed El Kamili, FSDM, Sidi Mohammed Ben Abdallah University, Fez,
Morocco.


*Local Co-Chairs*

Ismail Berrada, FSDM, Sidi Mohammed Ben Abdallah University, Fez, Morocco.

Abdelmajid Badri , FST Mohammadia, Hassan II University, Casablanca,
Morocco.


*Program Committee Chairs*

RachidEl-Azouzi, LIA, University of Avignon, France.

Mounir Ghogho, Leeds University England and UIR, Morocco.

Essaid Sabir, ENSEM, Hassan II University , Casablanca, Morocco.

*Publication Chairs*

Hicham Ghennioui, FST, Sidi Mohamed Ben Abdellah University, Fez, Morocco.

Lynda Mokdad, University of Paris-Est, Creteil, France.

*Publicity Chairs *

Hyunbum Kim, Ph.D. University of North Carolina at Wilmington.

Luca Foschini, DEIS-LIA, University of Bologna, Italy.

Shuai Han, Harbin Institute of Technology, China.

Ahmed Drissi El Maliani, FSDM, Sidi Mohamed Ben Abdellah University, Fez,
Morocco.

*Keynote and Panels chairs*

Abdellatif Kobbane, ENSIAS, Mohammed V University , Rabat, Morocco.

Mohammed Essaaidi, Director of ENSIAS, Rabat, Morocco.

*Sponsorship Chairs*

Amal Tmiri, Chouaib Doukkali University, El-Jadida, Morocco

Khalil Ibrahimi, IbnTofail University, Kenitra, Morocco.

*Special sessions and Tutorials Chairs*

Soumaya Cherkaoui, University of Sherbrooke, Canada.

Mohamed Et-Tolba, INPT, Rabat, Morocco

*Students Committee*

Afaf Bouhoute, FSDM, Sidi Mohamed Ben Abdellah University, Fez, Morocco.

Ahmed El Ouadrhiri, FSDM, Sidi Mohamed Ben Abdellah University, Fez,
Morocco.

Rachid Oucheikh, FSDM, Sidi Mohamed Ben Abdellah University, Fez, Morocco.

Imane Rahmouni, FSDM, Sidi Mohamed Ben Abdellah University, Fez, Morocco.

Imane Tamimi, FSDM, Sidi Mohamed Ben Abdellah University, Fez, Morocco.

Omar AitOualhaj,, ENSIAS, Mohammed V University of Rabat, Morocco.

Zakaria Ye, University of Avignon, France.



*Local Organizing Committee*

Mohammed El Hammoumi, Head of TI Laboratory and Coordinator of the Pole
TICSM , FST, USMBA Fez Morocco

Mohammed EL Mohajir, FSDM, USMBA Fez, IEEE Morocco section Chair

Rais Noureddine, Head of LIMS Laboratory, FSDM, USMBA Fez, Morocco

Abdelmoujib Benkirane, Head of LAMA Laboratory, FSDM, USMBA Fez, Morocco

Mohamed Karim, Head of LISTA Laboratory, FSDM, USMBA Fez, Morocco

Khalid ZENKOUAR, Member of LSIA Laboratory, FST, USMBA Fez, Morocco

M'Hammed Lahbabi, Head of LSSC Laboratory, FST, USMBA Fez, Morocco

Moulay Lahcen Hasnaoui, FSDM, USMBA Fez, Morocco

Ahmed Zinedine, FSDM, USMBA Fez, Morocco



Follow us and help us to talk about WINCOM 2016:

https://twitter.com/_WINCOM_

https://web.facebook.com/wincomconf.org?notif_t=page_invite_accepted&_rdr

Sincerely,

WINCOM 2016 Chairs.
